definition: to cook a meal over a campfire (usu. for a group of people on an outing)/cookout

sentences.chinese: 户外野炊经常开始得很慢。

sentences.english: The students, together with their teacher, are going to have a picnic this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 学生们打算这个周末与他们的老师一起去野炊。

sentences.english: Moreover, tourists often come and have picnics here, because of its beauty.
sentences.chinese: 要命的是，游客们慕名而来，经常烧烤野炊。

sentences.english: If you have a picnic, you'd better take some drinks.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们要去野炊，最好带些饮料。

sentences.english: One spring day the school arranged a picnic.
sentences.chinese: 有一年春天，学校安排了一次野炊郊游。

sentences.english: I've been invited to a cookout this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我这周末已经被邀去参加野炊。

sentences.english: We are going to have a picnic to morrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 明天上午我们打算去野炊。

sentences.english: Time permitting, we will have a picnic next week.
sentences.chinese: 时间允许的话，我们下星期将进行一次野炊。

sentences.english: I'm afraid this sudden wet weather has put paid to our picnic.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这突如其来的雨天已使我们的野炊付诸东流了。

sentences.english: Experience an all-American summer cook-out by the river.
sentences.chinese: 体验纯美式生活在河边野炊。

sentences.english: We are going to have a picnic tomorrow.
Who had picnics by the seaside yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 昨天我们在海边野炊了。

sentences.english: A. I know a place where we can have a picnic.
sentences.chinese: 我知道一个我们可以野炊的地方。

sentences.english: Because July is a  summer month, the weather is perfect for cooking and eating outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 因为7月是夏天，气候非常适合在户外野炊和聚餐。

sentences.english: What do you think of going for picnic this Sunday?
sentences.chinese: 你认为这个星期天去野炊怎么样？

definition: to go for an outing/to go on an excursion
outing in the country/to go on a hike/to go courting
lit. tread the green; go for a walk in the spring (when the grass has turned green)/spring hike season around Qingming festival 清明, 4th-6th April
game/wild animals and birds hunted for food or sport
